# relocation_info

macOS 10.8+

```
struct relocation_info {
    ...
};
```

## [Topics](/documentation/kernel/relocation_info#topics)

### [Instance Properties](/documentation/kernel/relocation_info#1597255)

[`r_address`](/documentation/kernel/relocation_info/1577793-r_address)In `MH_OBJECT` files, an offset from the start of the section to the item containing the address requiring relocation.[`r_extern`](/documentation/kernel/relocation_info/1577784-r_extern)Indicates whether the `r_symbolnum` field is an index into the symbol table (1) or a section number (0).[`r_length`](/documentation/kernel/relocation_info/1577791-r_length)Indicates the length of the item containing the address to be relocated. [`r_pcrel`](/documentation/kernel/relocation_info/1577785-r_pcrel)Indicates whether the item containing the address to be relocated is part of a CPU instruction that uses PC-relative addressing.[`r_symbolnum`](/documentation/kernel/relocation_info/1577798-r_symbolnum)Indicates either an index into the symbol table (when the `r_extern` field is set to 1) or a section number (when the `r_extern` field is set to 0). As previously mentioned, sections are ordered from 1 to 255 in the order in which they appear in the `LC_SEGMENT` load commands. This field is set to `R_ABS` for relocation entries for absolute symbols, which need no relocation.[`r_type`](/documentation/kernel/relocation_info/1577790-r_type)
